title: TFT is far too luck based right now.
body:
It honestly didn't seem as bad before, but this iteration is completely and utterly random. I had 3 builds I could utilize reliably, in the previous version. In this one, I can't use any build consistently. I worked my way up to platinum fast and easy, before, but I refuse to play ranked at this point. It's truly nothing but luck at this point.

The RNG is just far too severe at this point.

replies.body: I wouldn't even say luck based, more like completely rigged to purposely hide away units and items that you need if you've been doing too well recently. Incredibly frustrating, not really worth playing.
yeah its rigged.
This is how auto battlers work. It is an ultra-casual mode so bads can feel like they won something sometimes, just like battle royale games.
COMPLAINING ABOUT RNG IN A RNG BASED MODE
TFT would be a decent game if there was some actual strategy involved.. but you are correct it is RNG and not worth playing IMO.

Maybe that's how auto battlers are but it was always too luck based for me.
Maybe I got the wrong idea with the game being called auto chess but I feel the game is too much about eco and getting duplicate champs to upgrade and champs of the same set... and not enough about setting up the right team for the right job.
The game is somewhat playable when it's 1v1 since you know who you're up against and can make adjustments.
Problem is at that point your team is locked in more or less so you can only reposition champs which has less of an impact with all the champs that instantly teleport to a field on the board
If u only use 1 comp, yes its luck based. But if u know how to use multiple cores and playstyles, not so much luck.

I disagree, itemization is more important than ever now and without items most of the team compositions fall flat on their face. The carries lack meaningful burst or the tanks still just get deleted instantly, or you can't put a stop the healing from their light bonus because you don't have enough grevious. If you go with the flow and just keep taking inferno units because they keep popping up but  you have no items to back them, your damage won't be meaningful at all. It used to be comps > items now I think its the exact opposite. Items > comps, there are way more bad itemization choices than there were last season, heck even rapid fire canon has been dumpstered and barely has any decent uses now. The difference between kogmaw predator bonus/glacial rangers with hurricane as compared w/o is huge and game changing really or ,  turning malz into a mage, putting the right crit items on your assassins/adc, stacking those juicy tank items on a good front line..

The reason the same people are on the top of the ladder, is because they're committed to playing the same build every single game, and just accept that they'll win less than last season, since others are playing in the same meta.

The people on top of the ladder have far less of a win rate than last season, but the average win rate for each bracket has dropped significantly, so they're still on top.

For me personally, this isn't something I find fun. I don't enjoy any game with a strong RNG element. Sure, you can still end up being on the top of the heap, but if the act of playing isn't enjoyable, what's the point?
